quotes.quote: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
The only rock I know that stays steady, the only institution I know that works, is the family.
Civilization began the first time an angry person cast a word instead of a rock.
Man is harder than rock and more fragile than an egg.
Laws are sand, customs are rock. Laws can be evaded and punishment escaped, but an openly transgressed custom brings sure punishment.
A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.
Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.
A man of great memory without learning hath a rock and a spindle and no staff to spin.
The ship that will not obey the helm will have to obey the rocks.
Resolve will melt no rocks. But it can scale them.
A great rock is not disturbed by the wind; the mind of a wise man is not disturbed by either honor or abuse.
All history shows that the hand that cradles the rock has ruled the world, not the hand that rocks the cradle!
Don't look for an unshakable rock to stand on; there ain't any! Rather, learn how to stand still on a shaking rock!
Very little grows on jagged rock. Be ground. Be crumbled, so wildflowers will come up where you are.
Our way is not soft grass, it's a mountain path with lots of rocks. But it goes upwards, forward, toward the sun.
No rock so hard but that a little wave may beat admission in a thousand years.
Be like a headland of rock on which the waves break incessantly; but it stands fast and around it the seething of the waters sink to rest.
There will always be rocks in the road ahead of us. They will be stumbling blocks or stepping stones; it all depends on how you use them.
Stand through life firm as a rock in the sea, undisturbed and unmoved by its ever-rising waves.
Love is not enough. But, it is the rock on which all else stands.
Only the guy who isn't rowing has time to rock the boat.
Shooting stars are not stars at all. They re just rocks that enter the atmosphere and catch fire under friction. What we wish on when we see one is only a trail of debris.
If we have the courage and tenacity of our forebears, who stood firmly like a rock against the lash of slavery, we shall find a way to do for our day what they did for theirs.
How difficult it is to save the bark of reputation from the rocks of ignorance.
The cradle rocks above an abyss, and common sense tells us that our existence is but a brief crack of light between two eternities of darkness.
Rhyme is the rock on which thou art to wreck.
Just because the boat rocks doesn't mean it's time to jump overboard.
Look! Don't be deceived by appearances - men and things are not what they seem. All who are not on the rock are in the sea!
Not to have control over the senses is like sailing in a rudderless ship, bound to break to pieces on coming in contact with the very first rock.
Rock is a great master of life. It teaches us this simple philosophy: Stay firm!
